title-group.article-title: Production and Quality of Hot-Rolled Steel Sheets with Excellent Formability

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1986 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Hot rolled steel sheets having tensile strength of about 300MPa with excellent press formability have been developed by using RHâ€“degassing process and hot rolling technology.The basic chemical composition of new steel is chosen as extra low carbon, low manganese and low nitrogen to improve ductility. In addition, controlled cooling on runout table or microalloying of niobium is applied to prevent the grain coarsening, which is caused by leaner compositions. These steel sheets have high elongation and excellent press formability. Furthermore, these steel sheets exhibit a high resistance to cold-work embrittlement. These properties are compared with those of DQ grade mild steel sheets and interstitial free steel sheets. In this paper, the metallurgical basis of these new steel sheets and their characteristics are described.

ref.mixed-citation: M. Tate, O. Muroga, K. Araki, I. Inoue, M. Takahashi and K. Watanabe, "Development of continuously cast steel for common use as flat rolled products." Nippon kokan Technical Report overseas, No. 35 (1982).
M. Sakoh, K. Araki, O. Muroga and M. Tate, "Production and Mechanical Properties of Continuously Cast Low - Al - Low N Sheet Steels," AIME, Annual Meeting of TMS, No. A83-29 (1983)

T. Suda, K. Tayama, M. Sokoh, K. Araki, M. Wada and H. Kaj it ani, "Improvement of resistance to brittle fracture in extra low carbon niobium stabilized steel after press forming", Tetsu-To-Hagane, vol 69, No. 13 (1983)
Y. Ito, M. Nakazawa, Y. Nakazato and N. Ohashi, "Deep-drawing Quality Hot Rolled Steel Sheet KFN," Kawasaki Steel Corpora- tion Technical Report, vol 5, No. 2 (1973)
